analysis

Class Sequence

  • java.lang.Object
    • analysis.Sequence
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    AnalysedSequence, Gene

    public abstract class Sequence
extends java.lang.Object
    This class models an abstract DNA sequence which could be a reference gene or a given mutated sequence to analyze. It encapsulates the shared behavior of genes and sequences under analysis.
    Author:
    Ben Kohr

    • Constructor Detail

      • Sequence

        public Sequence(java.lang.String sequence,
                java.lang.String researcher)
        Creates a new Sequence object. As an abstract class, only inheriting classes can be created via this constructor. It sets the nucleotide sequence and the researcher's name as passed via the parameters. Furthermore, it determines the current date and stores internally.
        Parameters:
        sequence - the sequence of nucleotides
        researcher - the name of the analyzing researcher

    • Method Detail

      • getAddingDate

        public java.lang.String getAddingDate()

      • getComplementarySequence

        public java.lang.String getComplementarySequence()
                                          throws CorruptedSequenceException
        Returns the complementary version of this object's nucleotide sequence, i.e. all A nucleotides in the original sequence are replaced with T nucleotides (and vice versa) and all C nucleotides are replaced by G nucleotides (and vice versa).
        Returns:
        The complementary nucleotide sequence as a String
        Throws:
        CorruptedSequenceException - If a nucleotide letter different from A, T, C and G is observed

      • getComplementarySequence

        public java.lang.String getComplementarySequence(java.lang.String sequence)
        Returns the complementary version of this object's nucleotide sequence, i.e. all A nucleotides in the original sequence are replaced with T nucleotides (and vice versa) and all C nucleotides are replaced by G nucleotides (and vice versa).
        Returns:
        The complementary nucleotide sequence as a String
        Throws:
        CorruptedSequenceException - If a nucleotide letter different from A, T, C and G is observed

      • getResearcher

        public java.lang.String getResearcher()

      • getReversedSequence

        public java.lang.String getReversedSequence()
        Returns the reversed version of this object's nucleotide sequence, i.e. the nucleotide sequence is inverted.
        Returns:
        The reversed nucleotide sequence as a String

      • getSequence

        public java.lang.String getSequence()

      • setAddingDate

        public void setAddingDate(java.lang.String addingDate)

      • setResearcher

        public void setResearcher(java.lang.String researcher)

      • setSequence

        public void setSequence(java.lang.String sequence)
        This methods sets the internal nucleotide representation as a String constisting of the letters A, T, C and G. It also removes all internal whitespace characters and converts in to uppercase.
        Parameters:
        sequence - The nucleotide sequence to store in the object

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString()
        The toString-Method of Object is used to return the nucleotide sequence.
        Overrides:
        toString in class java.lang.Object
        Returns:
        the nucleotide sequence String (as a represenation of this object)
